717345f-a.text:
Broadway, north from 21st Street. The Fifth Avenue Hotel, the Albemarle, and the Hoffman House are seen in the left background.
About 1900.
Brown Brothers.

717343f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from 21st Street. The entire two blocks in the foreground, from 21st to 23rd Streets, will be unchanged some twenty-seven years later, in 1936, except for a 12story loft building, which will occupy the clearing shown here in the block between 21st and 22nd Streets. This clearing is the result of the demolition of three four-story houses. In 1936 the Bancroft House will be the Hotel Courte; and the Hotel Bartholdi, on the S.E. corner of 23rd Street, will be the Bartholdi Building, remodelled into an office building. But during this period of twenty-seven years there will be no demolitions and, with the exception noted, no construction work -- a long period in New York.
April, 1909.
Brown Brothers.

711573f-a.text:

CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE 1920.

717336f-a.text:
911-919 Broadway, south of, adjoining, and at the S.W. corner of 21st Street. 915 Broadway has just been demolished, but the corner lot, 917-919, has been vacant since 1916,at least.
November 20, 1924.
Uhnderwood & Underwood.

717346f-b.text:
Broadway, north from 21st Street. In the centre is the Fuller, or Flatiron Building, whose towering height of 21 stories once astounded New York and its visitors. Above the Fuller Building is the Fifth Avenue Building, on the site of the Fifth Avenue Hotel. The next two loft buildings replaced the Albemarle and the Hoffman
House.
1926.
Brown Brothers.

717342f-a.text:
A rear view of 915 Broadway, west side, south of East 21st Street, as seen across clearance directly on said corner.  On the left, appears No. 902 Broadway, at the N.E. corner of East 20th Street.  On the right, is the rear of No. 5 East 20th Street, north side, betweek Broadway and Fifth Ave.

December 2, 1924

Underwood & Underwood
